Zero to BinderHubÂ¶

A guide to help you create your own BinderHub from scratch. Each section below covers various aspects of creating cloud resources and setting up a BinderHub for your users.

Zero to BinderHub

  • 1. Create your cloud resources
    • 1.1. Setting up Kubernetes on Google Cloud
    • 1.2. Install Helm
  • 2. Set up the container registry
    • 2.1. Set up Google Container Registry
    • 2.2. Set up Docker Hub registry
    • 2.3. Set up Azure Container Registry
    • 2.4. Next step
  • 3. Set up BinderHub
    • 3.1. Preparing to install
    • 3.2. Create secret.yaml file
    • 3.3. Create config.yaml
    • 3.4. Install BinderHub
    • 3.5. Connect BinderHub and JupyterHub
    • 3.6. Try out your BinderHub Deployment
    • 3.7. Customizing your Deployment
  • 4. Tear down your Binder deployment
    • 4.1. Contracting the size of your cluster
    • 4.2. Deleting the cluster
